**Revised paragraph skeleton (to be inserted into the analysis)**  

> **Invariant anchors**: The U.S. real‑rate differential is currently ≈ –1.3 % (Fed policy rate 5.25 % – 12‑month CPI 3.9 %)【37UZC9X8I】. A 50 bp Fed cut (to 4.75 %) would widen the differential to –0.8 % and push the 10‑year yield toward 3.5 %–4.0 %【GX057ADL7】.  
> **Causal chain**: Fed policy → real‑rate differential → inflation expectations → equity risk‑premium → market pricing.  
> **Base case**: Fed remains hawkish until Q1 2026; a 50 bp cut in September (if CPI < 3.5 % and jobs < 260k) expands real rates, lifts the S&P 500 by 5 %–10 % over 12 months, with AI/tech leading.  
> **Upside scenario**: Unexpected dovish Jackson Hole (Aug 24‑25) or a softer September jobs report triggers an early cut, widening real rates to –0.5 % and a 12‑month equity rally of 12 %–15 %.  
> **Downside scenario**: Inflation remains sticky, Trump’s lawsuit forces a policy shift to a more dovish stance, but geopolitical escalation (Ukraine cease‑fire talks collapse) spikes risk‑premia, causing a 10‑bp yield spike and a 6 % equity pullback.  
> **Key risks**: (1) Sticky inflation; (2) Political pressure from Trump; (3) Geopolitical escalation.  
> **Watch points**: Powell’s Jackson Hole remarks (Aug 24‑25), September jobs data (first week of Sept), Treasury Secretary’s Fed‑cut comments (daily).  
> **Confidence**: Moderate‑to‑high, given clear policy‑data linkages but tempered by political volatility【S1H7IUGGE】【37UZC9X8I】.
